website_summaries.verdict: Best mix of price and performance for a tennis stringing machine you'll use at home.
pros: Machine that's pretty easy to use, making it a good choice to employ at home
Device includes a storage drawer underneath to keep all of your tools handy
Mounting system will keep your racket tightly in place while you're working
Better performance than others in this price range
cons: Made more for light-duty use, rather than for a tennis pro shop

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tennis Stringing Machine
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about getting a stringing machine. But I got the Gamma X ELS and I'm very happy with it. It's so easy to use that even my 12 year old daughter is now stringing her own racquet as well. The truth is that the documentation that comes with the machine is very poor and Gamma could have provided a more detail manual. Fortunately, there are YouTube videos online available to learn from.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ajao

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn and use.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to learn and use, especially with a starting clamp. Also bought a string meter to check my string job, and with it learning ways to be more consistent in maintaining the correct tension across the mains and crosses. Already strung 5 rackets, 5 more and It would have paid for itself. Very pleased with it, and very convenient for me since the closest restring shop is 35 miles away and I have to go back for my racket 3-7 days later.
customer_reviews.author: James D Cosper

customer_reviews.title: Do it yourself
customer_reviews.text: My husband strings his own tennis racquet on a machine that he bought at least 20 years ago. He finally decided to replace it with this model. He absolutely loves it. Took him a few minutes to figure certain component but mastered it soon after without reading the manual. This machine is sturdy yet compact. It has slots for the tools and looks rust resistance too. Also, there's room for add-ons.
customer_reviews.author: H. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Good product for a buget
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used it to re-strung ten times on my racket. Overall it is a good product, easy to use. It also included three set of strings. However, I feel that if you can go for a four-point support model, then go for it. This two-point support model put too much stress when pulling the cross strings. Your racket may break if you used tension on the higher end and your racket is not strong/fresh enough.
customer_reviews.author: natureadmirer

customer_reviews.title: The great thing its that I can reach the same results
customer_reviews.text: Ok, it s a basic machine, so for the price I m giving 5 stars, It brings everything you need to start stringing, nothing fancy, watched some videos from ytube and you ll be ready to go, ratchet system its a plus If you are not handy, with too delicate hands, stay away and just pay someone to do it for you. The great thing its that I can reach the same results, that my pro shop with a 5000$ machine Obs: Stringing for myself only, probably once a week. Maybe upgrading the clamps in the future, but they are fine
customer_reviews.author: Fer MS

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I was hoping it would do.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to string my own rackets to experiment, on a cost effective basis, what tensions might be best for me with the 103 and 113 sq in rackets I have. The stringer is sturdy and easy to work with (YouTube videos help). I keep track of how many hours I play with the strings and restring every 20-30 hours of playing time, so the savings are sizable vs paying someone else do it. Once or twice timeliness has been important also.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: came with missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I have reads others say that they have received their X2 with missing parts, I have never experienced this on Amazon, well i guess my streak of never just came to a screeching holt. I was missing one screw that holds down the racket and 2 floating clamps. I called GAMMA they promised to call me back. Amazon is willing to take it back but what a pitty....
customer_reviews.author: Speedo76

customer_reviews.title: good stringer
customer_reviews.text: good stringing machine for the price, comes with all the necessary tools. My friend suggested this one instead of floating clamps, and he was spot on with that suggestion. If you play often, break strings often, and don't want to pay $30+ per stringing, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Alexus Wong

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Assembly took about 30 minutes, was pretty easy to do. I've done about 10 string jobs on it so far, and it works fine. I wouldn't describe it as rock-solid, the racket table leans a little when you drop the weight. That doesn't affect the tension, so it's not a big concern. The fixed clamps are pretty solid. It's pretty easy to use. Obviously a drop weight is a little more work than an electric, but it's not bad once you get the hang of it. The price seems a little high for what it is, but you can't really find anything with the same features for less. Overall, a pretty good product.
customer_reviews.author: U. Hoerhold

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Atringing my own racquets have alllowed me to save a bunch of money. Expect to rexoup the investment in couple years. It has also enabled me to really experiment with different string types and tension. I also lend them out to my tennis buddies. Now, they owe me.
customer_reviews.author: someone

customer_reviews.title: DON'T USE X-2 FOR BADMINTON RACKET!!! WARNING!!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would save some money and buy this version with two balancing heads, but when I was stringing my badminton racket, my racket cracked!! I am very disappointed with this product since there were so many good reviews on it. I will never trust the stringing machine with two balancing points now.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: I just did my fourth racquet on this machine, and I have got into a rhythm. I add a few pounds from what my stringer used to do, and it now gives me consistent results. Great value. I actually think it's fun to do.
customer_reviews.author: Scribbler

customer_reviews.title: directions suck
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to use or understand the directions, which seem to be a little generic. Not easy to understand the tension. Don't think I will ever use it again; just wished I would have tried it during the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: It took my one or two tries to really get into my groove on this thing. I also have a racquet with O3 ports so it's a complicated racquet to string, but now I absolutely love it and it is such a money saver. I certainly recommend this product. Also, if you are thinking about getting a non-crank/manual machine I would advise against going to cheap and not getting the ratchet piece. The ratchet piece on this machine makes it what it is and saves you a ton of time in terms of getting the tension right.
customer_reviews.author: The Opinionator

customer_reviews.title: no useful manual comes with it
customer_reviews.text: works as well as can be expected for a low-end tennis stringing machine. a little difficult to work with the free clamps (as opposed to the fixed clamps found in higher end machines) but becomes more manageable with repeated use. no useful manual comes with it, so the inexperienced user will have to learn how to string from you-tube videos, and then develop their own stringing style. works well enough as a starter stringing machine and for those on a budget
customer_reviews.author: dman

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: This kit has everything we need to string, including 3 different strings. Only thing which is not in there is a string cutter.
customer_reviews.author: arn amazn

customer_reviews.title: Does an excellent job
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered this due to excellent reviews not just from amazon. It's well made and designed. The only flaw i can find is that the clamps bottom corner have a little sharp edges but no problem. I just used the long nose plier that came with it and pile the edges. The tension winder is awesome which helps you set the tension's accuracy before dropping the weight. I thought getting the drop weight horizontally(to get the desired tension) is faster with it. The storage space works perfectly too where you can organized the tools. Im a first time stringer so my first racquet with this took me 4.5 hrs then 1.5 the 2nd time.
customer_reviews.author: AL Pogi

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for price
customer_reviews.text: Just got one of these and have never strung a racquet before. Took on to youtube and found some tutorials and I was up and running. The first few were not good but after I did a couple of racquets I got the hang of the machine and its quirks. Its very easy and the build quality is great so things dont rattle or clink or anything. I can get a racquet done in about 1:15 mins. Trying to bring it down to about 45mins. But just like tennis it will take a good bit of practice.
customer_reviews.author: yaya

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to restring my racket, save a lot of money! Watch you tube video to learn how to string is much faster than the instructions booklet!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do it yourself for less
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have invested in this sooner. After paying to have my rackets strung for several years i decided to give it a try myself. Extremely easy to use. There are plenty of videos that you can watch to learn the technique. I have now strung 6 rackets and it is saving me money. It lets me try out different strings and tensions for just the cost of the string.
customer_reviews.author: I. Skarlis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! I can try as many strings I want without worrying about the money spent.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. After stringing a few times you get used to the mechanics of the process and it becomes easy. The best thing is that now I can try many different strings without paying for the service. Usually good strings costs like 10 bucks and the service 20. I spend around 40~50 minutes to string my racket with this machine. Totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Received extra Gamma strings by registering the machine
customer_reviews.text: The order comes w/ 3 set of Gamma strings (Jet, TNT, Livewire) for each of the Gamma string player style listed on their website. A total surprise to receive 2 additional sets of Jet 16L after registering the machine. It will be interesting to try out these strings and tweet tension to experiement.
customer_reviews.author: T Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great stringer for the value
customer_reviews.text: This stringer has the ease and reliability that the drop weight system provides along with the 6 point mounting and fixed clamps. It is truly one of a kind on the market. I have not found many others that give the 6 point, fixed clamp feature in a practical, inexpensive drop weight system. I have strung several racket and really like how this works. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a great value in a stringer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boyfriend loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as an anniversary gift for my boyfriend who I play tennis with almost every day. He’s been wanting to get one and I got it for him instead🤗
customer_reviews.author: Shanna Chua

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Stringer!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was hoping for. Arrived in great shape and on-time. I was originally considering the crank-style machine rather than the drop weight, thinking that it would save me time. I have found that the tensioning on this machine using the drop weight is not the time consuming part of the job, and am very happy with the speed and excellent quality of this machine. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: New to stringing
customer_reviews.text: We were tired of driving an hour and paying $25 to have racquets strung several times a year so ordered this machine. After many hours of watching YouTube videos, we were able to start stringing racquets for ourselves and other people that play tennis. Just by charging a few dollars over what the string cost, we were able to make our money back. I like this stringing machine very much.
customer_reviews.author: NW

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This stringer is great its cheap and it works the only annoying thing is the floating clamp kinda suck and you have to work around them . the package came with 4 sets of strings so I was able to practice a bit before installing my regular strings. I would give this 5 stars but the floating clamps draw it back a bit
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: String both badminton racquet and tenis racquet
customer_reviews.text: Machine is good for tennis , I wish the seller include a clamp for badminton racquet.
customer_reviews.author: Cuu

customer_reviews.title: use for home need. string one racket every 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: use for home need. string one racket every 2 weeks. must have for someone who plays regularly
customer_reviews.author: fanamazon

customer_reviews.title: It does not work for badminton racket!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Gamma x2 in May for badminton racket. Today when i try to use it first time. i noticed the floating clamps does not work for the racket. also the gripper is too long and block a lot of string holes.
customer_reviews.author: Yamin

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done. But I wish to have the following improvements. 1. The dial teeth should be bigger. I have very difficult time to grab it when tension is high. It is slippery. 2. The rack mount screws should be redesigned. It is difficult to make an adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great value.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first racket stringer, and so far I like it a lot. Thanks to videos on YouTube I taught myself how to string tennis rackets late 2015. So far I've strung 3-4 rackets and each one came out perfectly. This will pay for itself within a year. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B

customer_reviews.title: Going from a manual crank to a drop weight
customer_reviews.text: Long story short my table top crank machine stopped working. I've watched a few youtube videos on this before buying. Coming from a crank Machine to drop weight didn't take too long to adjust. With floating clamps I was more used to the fixed clamps, so you can imagine I had a hard time starting. It only took me 40 mins as opposed to 30 mins on my crank, since I do have experience stringing racquets in general. Overall a good product and the tension is accurate
customer_reviews.author: DamianDT

customer_reviews.title: Works like supposed to
customer_reviews.text: If all you need is to simply restring your racquets then this would do well for you. But you should search ebay for used tennis stringing machines you will get a better deal. This was expensive but still better than going to Sports authority or dicks for restring for $20 every time you break your strings. Make sure to buy bulk in strings too it is much cheaper that way.
customer_reviews.author: Lue Yang

customer_reviews.title: Best investment ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best budget stringer matching in the market! I’m very happy with the purchase. If You have to restring your racquet often and want to save some money this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Maffiold

customer_reviews.title: Gets job done
customer_reviews.text: Good price. I was used to a more expensive machine with fixed clamps and a latch that clicked after the proper tension was reached. It took a while to get used to the swing bar and the floating clamps but it does work to string racquets.
customer_reviews.author: J Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Gamma X-Stringer
customer_reviews.text: Nice all around machine, I’ve been using drop weight machines for years, this provides very consistent string bed, prestreching function is a huge plus, if budget allows this is a solid option for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Armen Byzantine

customer_reviews.title: The string machine is well received, but it doesn't contain a clamp
customer_reviews.text: The string machine is well received, but it doesn't contain a clamp.I can't use it without a clamp.I just want you to send back the clamp. I can't refund it. I'm international buyer. What should I do?
customer_reviews.author: Mr. LEE

customer_reviews.title: This machine came in on time and in perfect condition. The first racket that I strung was ...
customer_reviews.text: This machine came in on time and in perfect condition. The first racket that I strung was so easy to do. The tension wouldn't slip like my old machine. I love this stringing machine and wondered why I didn't pick this up earlier so I didn't have to struggle my rackets.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Nagamine

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this works. I love stringing my own racquets. I am glad I got the model with the six point mounting system and metal clamps.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. This is my first stringer so I don't have a lot to compare it to, but, it is quite easy to use. I bought this because I wanted to start experimenting with different strings but didn't want to waist $40 per string job to find I didn't like the string. This way, all I'm waisting is time. I would say this is great for personal stringing, but if you were trying to make money stringing for others, this one takes a bit of time and in the long run may not be the best return on time. Great price!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy N

customer_reviews.title: Great starter stringer!
customer_reviews.text: This stringing machine allows me to string my racquets as well as I had them strung by someone else. It comes with all the tools you need. Four sets of string and instructions. I found the videos on Youtube especially useful to get started.
customer_reviews.author: Don K

customer_reviews.title: this is a great stringer and has a lot of features that my ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a great stringer and has a lot of features that my klipspringer stringer did not have. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: bobby

customer_reviews.title: 3 packages of string, great machine.
customer_reviews.text: Great machine. My only disappointment was that some people claim to have gotten 12 packages of string, some 8, some 4. We got 3. Just FYI.
customer_reviews.author: ellen brown

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the DIYstringer. Already paid for itself. The ratchet is a huge advantage over competition.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ee

customer_reviews.title: Good machine with not so good manual
customer_reviews.text: The clamps on my set are made of metal, just like what are shown in the photo. The manual is not so helpful for someone who is trying to do stringing for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: S Li

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good value, although tools included with stringer aren't very good. You will need to get your own pliers and clippers.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and once you get the technique down ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a wedding gift for my husband and he LOOOOVES it!!! So easy to use and once you get the technique down it's super quick to string!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Jeffries

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Ive been stringing rackets now for a while, and this works really well! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: A solid machine
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this machine for over a year and half now, at a frequency about 2 rackets a month. I strung badminton rackets only. It works perfect, even with high tension (>= 27lb). The suspension system firmly holds the racket. The base is plastic, but is steady enough. One thing I regret is that I forgot to ask for badminton clamps. But that is my fault. However, using a fly clamp for crossing is quite acceptable. Overall, solid machine, suitable for personal use.
customer_reviews.author: Wang

customer_reviews.title: Great Mobile Stringer at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: The free same day shipping was amazing! Also the bonus strings were nice to have. As an experienced stringer who was downgrading to a more travel friendly machine, this one meets and exceeds everything I want in a stringer.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Cating

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tennis Stringing Machine
customer_reviews.text: Just bought the Gamma X-2 Tennis Stringing Machine for $159.00. It came with 5 free Gamma strings. With the free strings, the machine costs about $59.00. Don't even look at the manual, it will only confuse you. Instead go to Youtube and find a how to restring a tennis racquet video. The 1st time took me about 1 1/2 hours to restring my racquet. I feel confident that I'll be able to restring all future racquets within 40 minutes. I recommend this machine to all tennis players. It's a relatively easy way to restring your racquets at a very reasonable price. You can buy top of the line tennis restringing machines for over $3,000.00, but why?
customer_reviews.author: btntexas

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Well made, very sturdy. Took me a while for the first time stringing, but much easier the next round. No matter will take at least an hour to do a racket.
customer_reviews.author: SCS enterprises

customer_reviews.title: Well built and easy to use for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Well built and easy to use for a beginner. Stringed two racquets so far. Instructions & equipment needed included.
customer_reviews.author: WL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works very well with consistent string tension, at least according to my string meter.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Bought it around 2 years back. Waiting for 2 or more days at the local shop is over. Could not have done with out the youtube videos. Still using the original accessories, stringer came with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it should do
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Took me a couple of attempts, but have got a pretty good technique going that's relatively fast.
customer_reviews.author: L. Korus

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This product works great! There are no complaints as far as the quality or the clips or the accessories that come with the stringer. The only slight negative is that I found the "how to string a racquet instructions" confusing. But, you can look up how to string a racquet in a number of different ways (YouTube etc). Also the racquet came with a few free packs of string! 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.author: Stringery

customer_reviews.title: Good Stringer
customer_reviews.text: i love this stringer. just got it today! it shipped very fast and took about 6 days to arrive. it is a good stringer, especially for the price. it is great for beginners like me. the only thing i critisize is the clamps. they are very hard to use. it is hard to unclamp the strings also. i would definitely recommend this to others. if you would like you can purchase other clamps if you are not happy with the ones provided. Also the stringer came with 6 sets of strings which is great. overall it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: alex0330

customer_reviews.title: good enough!
customer_reviews.text: It is good enough for amature to string himself. Tension is not accrate sometimes due to fractions of different material of strings, or different methode of string.
customer_reviews.author: kimsuamu

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. String my racquets myself with no issue and save money.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wist

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal. My 15 years old daughter is now ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent deal. My 15 years old daughter is now the Tennis racket stringer for the family :) I gave 4 stars just for the lack of effort giving instructions. I was lucky that my neighbour have the same unit and they gave us a demo. Nothing on YouTube that is exact. It came with two generic manuals that is not specific to this model. Build quality is excellent and pretty accurate tension.
customer_reviews.author: Spybreak

customer_reviews.title: Good for badminton rackets.
customer_reviews.text: Good for badminton racket. Haven't used for tennis racket yet.
customer_reviews.author: Haosen Wen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed I didn't receive any sample strings whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: Stringing machine is adequate. The assembly instructions are a little unclear, but functional enough. Disappointed I didn't receive any sample strings whatsoever, but perhaps they stopped giving them out with the machine?
customer_reviews.author: EverybodyJustCalmDown

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This product works great! It may take a little time to master for beginners like myself but even the slightly erratic job I did on my first string job worked pretty good and, because it comes with 5 strings, there is room for errors.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Robbins

customer_reviews.title: String your own!
customer_reviews.text: I liked it. Very solid and comes with tools. A very good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Good Price for a Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This stringer worked well for the price! I have strung 2 rackets with it and am satisfied with the results so far. Stinger appears to be well made, with quality metal construction.
customer_reviews.author: Toby C.

customer_reviews.title: Everything works fine but the base of the machine is not stable ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything works fine but the base of the machine is not stable on my stringer at the base. It's annoying that it's wobbling.
customer_reviews.author: teppei ahn

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Great product by Gamma. Recommend going on YouTube to get some lessons on how to use this stringing and on how to string in general. Again this is a great budget home stringing machine.
customer_reviews.author: King0fHeart

customer_reviews.title: Stringer!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my stringer! I went on youtube and learned how to string BEFORE I bought it and the very first time using it was perfect! It is simple to use and fun.
customer_reviews.author: dollywwod1

customer_reviews.title: Gamma Strining Machine Review
customer_reviews.text: Great product...came with EVERYTHING needed to do a professional stringing job...including 5 sets of string...which, if purchased and installed at a pro shop, would've cost almost as much as the entire machine and tools...maybe more !!! From the 6th stringing on the biggest cost will be your time...it does take a while to do a great job !!! I don't know what a more expensive machine can do better or faster, but I don't know why anyone would want/need to spend more...this machine works very well !!!
customer_reviews.author: Coach Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great stringer!!
customer_reviews.text: This stringer is so easy to use. I can string a racquet in 25 minutes with this machine. I love how it is compact and stores nicely. It also has a drawer that holds stores my tools.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Hanan

customer_reviews.title: First time stringer!
customer_reviews.text: After finally getting up the courage to string my own racquets this product works great. I had to watch a Utube video of someone doing this on this machine to figure it out. Now so easy! My first stringing took 4 hours! Now I am down to about 45 minutes to an hour, taking my time. If you are like me and break a lot of strings this will eventually pay for itself. I also like because I can now experiment with different strings and tensions!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the part-time user
customer_reviews.text: We bought this stringing machine and have loved it. It is perfect for the average tennis player and will save lots of money. The ordering was no hassle. Learning how to string can be a bit tricky. Once you figure it out, it is smooth sailing from then on!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Eric Curtis, Ph.D., NCSP, MSCP

customer_reviews.title: Good as gold!
customer_reviews.text: Appears solidly built. Haven't got anything to compare to but nothing about it feels "cheap". Did the job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I will get used to it about three times. I think that it is very economical.
customer_reviews.author: Kentaro Suzuki

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son's on the high school tennis team. Made my money back in stringing costs within a year.
customer_reviews.author: P. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to use, works perfectly. I have stringed several badminton racquets with it. It is strongly suggested.
customer_reviews.author: easy

customer_reviews.title: Very good and sturdy product that does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I am into my 6th job and really getting a hang of this. Very good and sturdy product that does what it says.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic with metal Clamp, not good for badminton
customer_reviews.text: the machine is great, while the tool is for tennis more than badminton. The fixed clamp is metal with plastic coat. It is good clamp. While, it is not used for badminton. I will need to buy a new fixed clamp for "badminton". that's extra about 60-100 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: bread

customer_reviews.title: Sparse instructions..no strings
customer_reviews.text: If you have not strung a racket before, the instruction manual is worthless. Strings were not supplied as listed in the description.
customer_reviews.author: 10s fan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got this for christmas for my brother and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Larkin

customer_reviews.title: Easy stringing with this machine
customer_reviews.text: I did my string using this machine. It turns out to be great. The actual product package contains more items than those shown in the picture. 6 strings are included so that you can start to use them immediately. The floating clamp(adjustable) could be tight if it is not adjusted properly. Putting some kind of tape on the clamp can be more safe. Watching the instruction video from Youtube helps a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Sports

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Everything you need in one package. I have strung about 20 tennis rackets and the unit is holding up fine. Learn your knots! I am still using the original clamps and will upgrade them soon. Go ahead buy with confidence!
customer_reviews.author: Bluebonnet

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. A bit slower than the more expensive stringers but It gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: Marion

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect set up!!!! Love this thing. SUPER FAST DELIVERY, LESS THAN 8 HOURS.
customer_reviews.author: brent v thomas

customer_reviews.title: Best stringer any where near it's price range!
customer_reviews.text: Light years ahead of my less capable flying clamp machine. Worth every penny for it's precision and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Tucker

customer_reviews.title: great first string machine!!
customer_reviews.text: The unit came packaged well...small piece of molded plastic broken on one end..cosmetic. Strung first racquet..excellent stringing..love the machine..i would recommend this as a first machine..been playing tennis for 25 years. Good product and good clamps.
customer_reviews.author: moodyblues

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my husband who strung two raquets on it so far. Takes a while because it is a completely manual process (nothing mechanized), but works as expected. Very compact and easy to store. Clamps are hard to un-clamp. Several strings included. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: LEFox

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Although I did have to wait a couble of weeks for delivery, for the price I paid it was well worth the wait. Every other site wanted double if not more. I've only used it a few times and it performs like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great starter machine for new stringer
customer_reviews.text: This machine is well built and very easy to use, it came with some basic tools. The drawer at the base is nice feature. You can do a pretty good string job on this machine, but if you are picky you will want a machine with fixed cramp, which cost $500+. Make sure you order a starter cramp too.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Manual stringers like this are good but the going is slow
customer_reviews.text: Go for a mechanized stringer if you can. Manual stringers like this are good but the going is slow.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: easy to use but the document helped little bit. If good document I will rate 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to use and he is able to string his ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my husband and he just loves it. It is easy to use and he is able to string his own racquets fairly quickly. It came with three packs of demo strings and a pack of decent strings. Well worth the investment if you play a lot of tennis and go through a lot of racquets due to broken strings.
customer_reviews.author: Kokoro_Chan

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: one plastic cap was broken. when the tension is over 23lb, the clamp moves a little.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good stringer. I have already used it for several rackets.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Money saver!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Had never strung a racquet before, and had my racquet strung at the correct tension within an hour and a half after removing the stringer from the box (it helped that the stringing example used the same string pattern as my racquet). If only I had purchased this sooner, I could've saved hundreds of dollars! Just one piece of advice: when stringing through the tensioner, don't get too much string wrapped around the clamp, or it will be difficult to get the clamp to release when you raise the arm to release tension.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Bakula

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. Very easy to use and does not take up a lot space. I bought it a month ago and I have already made the cost of the unit by stringing my own rackets. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gamma x-2, the best of the cheap machines.
customer_reviews.text: everything looks great. 3 package of strings came with the machine. very good product for those who want string in their home for personal use and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Belen Rondon

customer_reviews.title: Machine is good though.
customer_reviews.text: Machine was boxed and packed well. Seems to work well but returned it because stringing is harder than it looks. Lots of you tube videos on tennis racquet string but not much on squash. Which is why I bought it. More work than I wanted. Machine is good though.
customer_reviews.author: squash

product_meta.title: Gamma X-Stringer Tennis Racquet Stringing Machine: Tabletop Racket String Machine with Tools and Accessories - Tennis, Squash and Badminton Racket Stringer
product_meta.description:
FIRM HOLD 
The Gamma Sports X-Stringer stringing machines allows anyone to restring their racquet with professional precision. It’s constructed with either a two-point racquet mounting system or a 6-point Quick Mount System with “V” mounts that keep your racquet firmly in place while you work. Install any kind of string on your tennis, racquetball, squash or badminton racquets quicker and easier than ever before. 

CUSTOM STRING TENSION 
Get the string tension perfect for your needs with the Gamma X-Stringer racquet stringer. The machine’s drop weight tensioning mechanism accommodates 9 to 90 lbs (4 to 41 kgs), and the nickel chrome plated steel bar turntable rotates 360 degrees for greater ease of use. 

DURABLE DESIGN 
Gamma has been manufacturing stringing machines for more than 25 years and ensures all equipment is made to the highest standards. The X-Stringer stringer features a strong yet lightweight aluminum extrusion base with a durable anodized finish and built-in tool tray and drawer. The rotating ratchet gripper has diamond dust coated gripping surfaces for a reliable grip and added durability. Additionally, the universal string clamps contain a unique self-locking adjustment knob to provide the ideal amount of clamping pressure for badminton and tennis racquets, although the teeth spacing is optimized for use with squash and racquetball racquets as well. 

TOOL SET 
For your convenience, we’ve included a pathfinder awl, straight awl, hex wrenches, straight pliers and cutter. You’ll also receive 3 sets of high-quality Gamma tennis string and a United States Racquet Stringers Association stringing guide. 

EASY TO USE 
Gamma stringing machines are ideal for athletes, coaches, parents and business owners who regularly restring racquets. The X-Stringer stringer is backed by a 5-year limited warranty with a 1-year warranty on string gripping components and electronic components.
feature_bullets: FIRM HOLD: Two composite floating clamps and a two-point mounting system keep racquets in place
CUSTOM STRING TENSION: A drop weight tensioning machine with a 9-90lb range and 360-degree turntable
DURABLE DESIGN: Features an aluminum extrusion base and diamond-coated rotational ratchet gripper
TOOL SET: A pathfinder awl, straight awl, hex wrenches and straight pliers with cutter are included
EASY TO USE: Gamma X2 string machines are easy to operate and backed by a limited lifetime warranty
